com.esri.mo2.src.sys
Class SourceCache

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.src.sys.SourceCache
public final class SourceCache
extends Object

Sources may be cached here, so that Datasets produced from this Source are unique.

Here is a typical sequence of events for connecting with a Source:

   Connection connection = new ConnectionImplementation(connection-specific parameters...);
   Source source = SourceCache.getSource(connection);
   if (false == source.isConnected())
       source.connect();
   ....
   source.disconnect();

See Also:
Source, Connection

Method Summary
static Source getSource(Connection connection)
          obtain a Source corresponding with the given Connection from a cache of Sources.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

getSource

public static Source getSource(Connection connection)
obtain a Source corresponding with the given Connection from a cache of Sources. The cache is backed by a HashMap - the key is the Connection, and the value is a SoftReference to the Source, so that when the Source is no longer used by any outside code, it will be available for garbage collection regardless of being cached.
